intro: Hypochaeris leontodontoides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it typically grows in meadows and grassy areas. Hypochaeris leontodontoides is a perennial herb with a rosette of basal leaves and erect flowering stems. It is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
